fullText: Read More About: Broadway, Hal Prince Jump to Comments ‘How to Dance in Ohio’ Review: Musical About Autistic Young Adults Is a Touching Broadway First Belasco Theater; 1,024 seats, $179 top. Reviewed Dec. 7, 2023. Opened Dec. 10. Running time: 2 HOURS 30 MINS Production: A presentation by P3 Productions, Ben Holtzman, Sammy Lopez, Fiona Howe Rudin, Level Forward, Abigail E. Disney, Paul Canaan/Greg Kamp, Jonathan Pollard/Michael Feldman, Tom D’Angora & Michael D’Angora, Emily Blavatnik, ShowTown Productions, Betsy Pitts, PPMF Productions, The David and Lura Lovell Foundation, Dina S. Friedler, Judith Ann Abrams Productions/The Broadway Investor’s Club, Jennifer Allan Soros, Howard & Nancy Alter, Burnt Umber Productions, Julie Cohen, Con Simon Productions, CR Productions/Axler & Granger, Raymond & Samantha Esposito, Freedom Theatricals, Lindsay Gates, John Gore Organization, Lucy Lawless & Rob Tapert, Michael J. Moritz Jr., Julie Parker Benello, Denny Paschall & Elora Decarlo, Quinones & Das, Abby Schreer, The Shubert Organization, Laurie Tisch & Emily Tisch Sussman, Tyce-Hill-Steinfast, Elizabeth Zola, Plate Spinner Productions, Isabel Rose & Jeff Fagan, Beth Rudin DeWoody, New Vintage Theatricals, Bertone-Justice/Independent Producers Network, PerlJam Productions/About Time Entertainment, Denise m& Lon Bevers/Andrew Caravella, Gary & Marlene Cohen/Michael B. Cox, DeNovo Initiative/Ryan Duncan Ayala, Lisa & Brian Feldman, Funroe Productions, The Wharton Center/John Yonover, Jeffrey Grove-WitzEnd/Kathryn Cole Feldman, Paris Keena, Willette & Manny Klausner, Ladybug Productions/Vasi Laurence, New Stage Productions/Nick Padgett PROSCENIUM/Theatre Producers of Color, Songbird Productions/Jamie Stone O’Brien, Jefferson W. Tidwell/Van Dean Productions, Anne Keating, Christen James, Melissa Jessel, Paula Abdul of a musical in two acts with music by Jacob Yandura and book and lyrics by Rebekah Greer Melocik. Crew: Directed by Sammi Cannold; sets, Robert Brill; costumes, Sarafina Bush; choreography, Mayte Natalio; music direction, Lily Ling; orchestrations, Bruce Coughlin; music arranger, Jacob Yandura; additional music arrangements, Matt Gallagher; music coordinator, Michael Aarons; lighting, Bradley King; sound, Connor Wang; production stage manager, Scott Rowen. Cast: Caesar Samayoa, Desmond Lúis Edwards; Amelia Fei, Madison Kopec, Liam Pearce, Conor Tague, Ashley Wool, Imani Russell, Haven Burton, Darlesia Cearcy, Carlos L. Encinias, Nick Gaswirth, Melina Kalomas, Christina Sastre.
dtliExcerpt: The musical adaptation of Alexandra Shiva's 2015 documentary is a tender, authentic portrayal of young adults on the autism spectrum preparing for a spring formal dance.
showScoreExcerpt: The musical adaptation of Alexandra Shiva's 2015 documentary is a tender, authentic portrayal of young adults on the autism spectrum preparing for a spring formal dance.

llmScore.reasoning: [ensemble-unanimous] | All 3 models agree: Positive | Claude: The additional context describes the show as 'tender, authentic' which indicates positive assessment, though the main review text is mostly setup. The positive descriptors suggest recommendation despite limited evaluative content. | GPT-4o: The review describes the musical as a 'tender, authentic portrayal,' which suggests a positive view. However, the absence of stronger language or explicit recommendation keeps the score in the lower range of the Positive bucket. | Gemini: The review describes the musical as a "tender, authentic portrayal," which indicates a positive recommendation, although not an enthusiastic one. The lack of stronger positive language suggests a score in the lower end of the positive range.
